page.title: 14CHANGES IN STEWARTBY
page.content: Written by David Grummitt and Matthew Blood, aged 18. On 27th. February 1984, the multi-million pound Hanson Trust conglomerate obtained the majority shareholding in the Stewartby-based London Brick Company at a cost of Â£250m. It was the object of this survey to portray the effects on a community which has been described as a "family village" set out on a "garden plan", and whether recent developments will mean the break-up of the community with the subsequent effects on the villagers. We took it upon ourselves to make a conclusion, as to whether the Hanson Trust, with a reputation of making profits at all costs, will bring to an end the idea of a "family village".
